abstract: Rutgers University women's basketball coach C Vivian Stringer prepares to face arch rival University of Connecticut coach Geno Auriemma in second round of NCAA tournament; UConn is only team that has consistently beaten Rutgers since she took over team in 1995.
lead_paragraph: C. Vivian Stringer, a Hall of Famer with more than 900 victories, is 6-33 against Connecticut during her Rutgers tenure. The teams are set to meet in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

headline.main: Rutgers’s Coach Is Used to Winning, but Not When She Faces UConn
headline.print_headline: Rutgers’s Coach Is Used to Winning, but Not When She Faces UConn

snippet: C. Vivian Stringer, a Hall of Famer with more than 900 victories, is 6-33 against Connecticut during her Rutgers tenure. The teams are set to meet in the N.C.A.A. tournament.
